text: guys, i was chatting with Justin yesterday about resources / whitepaper downloads
and how we dont think people should have to enter their email addresses to download them, although we suspect they’ll probably want that info
i’m designing solutions for both
and then i remembered that this also annoying thing exists: <https://paywithasocialpost.com/>

attachments.text: Pay With A Social Post provides an easy to use and free system to pay with a social post for digital goods. The goods can be bought via posts on Facebook, Twitter or Google+.
attachments.fallback: Pay With A Social Post provides an easy to use and free system to pay with a social post for digital goods. The goods can be bought via posts on Facebook, Twitter or Google+.

text: but its less annoying than entering personal info perhaps?
hmm
i think it warrants discussion with team Trapit
i'm leary
agreed
or leery?
i think ideal situation is straight download
yes
agreed on that
if we're all agreed here, think we put it forward as recommendation
with some motivations to back it up
yes. i’m planning for what seems inevitable, and will have a design solution in my back pocket for email address capture.
cool/appreciated
but as much as we have content guidelines, i think we should write up motivational guidelines too
but will try and remain optimistic about it :)
thats a good idae
*idea
e.g. don't trap content behind bullshit data capture traps
yeah - here’s the thing
and I have no idea how to say this
but they’re stuff isn’t going to be worth it for people if there’s a gate in front of it
they’re not forester
right
i think that's how we say it
so really - it’s in their best interest to get as many people as possible reading their stuff
listen pat - you ain’t forester
and phrasing it like that is actually the rationale
we want reach with this launch
vs. exclusivity
yeah
good thinking
this feels like brand building
establish TI as the best brand in this space
absolutely, which i think hank is totally on board with
i just dont think pat and gary really know what that means

well - I think (and this is where it all goes wrong for me) - that the way to explain it is that with the gate in place they’re going to lose like 99 chances to establish a really great brand connection for the chance to get 1 email
and that 1 email could be any one - there is no guarantee that it’s any one worth those other 99 opportunities
:thumbsup:
all that said - more often then not when I’ve tried to have this conversation I get the rolling eyes and they just want the gate
but - thats the logic any way
